---
slug: /128
title: "This Week In React #128: SWR, Vite, Codux, Storybook, Next.js, Forget, Nylon, Paper, align-deps, INP, Zod, Tauri..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 12-13-2022
---
Hi everyone!
We are entering the Christmas season, and React bloggers are reducing the pace. On my side, I will skip 2 editions.

translations.fr: Nous entrons dans la saison des f√™tes, et les blogueurs React ralentissent leur rythme. De mon c√¥t√©, je vais sauter 2 √©ditions.
translations.en: Nous entrons dans la p√©riode de No√´l, et les blogueurs React ralentissent leur rythme. De mon c√¥t√©, je vais sauter 2 √©ditions.

segments.source_content: Still, we have some nice releases and articles to discover. I really liked the article about font layout shifts.

translations.fr: N√©anmoins, nous avons de belles sorties et articles √† d√©couvrir. J'ai particuli√®rement appr√©ci√© l'article sur les d√©calages de mise en page des polices.

## üí∏ Sponsor {#sponsor1}
[![React Bricks is a CMS with visual editing based on React components](/emails/issues/128/reactbricks.png)](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=this_week_in_react)

translations.fr: [![React Bricks est un CMS avec √©dition visuelle bas√© sur des composants React](/emails/issues/128/reactbricks.png)](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=this_week_in_react)
translations.en: [![React Bricks est un CMS avec √©dition visuelle bas√© sur des composants React](/emails/issues/128/reactbricks.png)](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=this_week_in_react)

segments.source_content: **[React Bricks is a CMS with visual editing based on React components](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=this_week_in_react)**

translations.fr: **[React Bricks est un CMS avec √©dition visuelle bas√© sur des composants React](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=this_week_in_react)**
translations.en: **[React Bricks est un CMS avec √©dition visuelle bas√© sur des composants React](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=this_week_in_react)**

segments.source_content: **It's flexible for Developers**: create your own design system using React components, add Visual editing in your JSX and add sidebar controls to edit props like the background color. Choose Next.js, Gatsby or Remix and any CSS framework you like!

translations.fr: **Flexible pour les d√©veloppeurs** : cr√©ez votre propre syst√®me de design avec des composants React, ajoutez l'√©dition visuelle dans votre JSX et des contr√¥les lat√©raux pour modifier les props comme la couleur d'arri√®re-plan. Choisissez Next.js, Gatsby ou Remix et n'importe quel framework CSS !
translations.en: **Flexible pour les d√©veloppeurs** : cr√©ez votre propre syst√®me de design avec des composants React, ajoutez l'√©dition visuelle dans votre JSX et des contr√¥les lat√©raux pour modifier les props comme la couleur de fond. Choisissez Next.js, Gatsby ou Remix et n'importe quel framework CSS !

segments.source_content: **It's easy for Content editors** who can directly edit in a visual way without breaking the design system: much easier than editing abstract entities using gray fields, as in a headless CMS. **And you save time**, as Content editors are autonomous!

translations.fr: **Simple pour les r√©dacteurs** qui peuvent √©diter visuellement sans compromettre le design : bien plus intuitif que de modifier des entit√©s abstraites dans des champs gris, comme avec un CMS headless. **Et vous gagnez du temps** gr√¢ce √† l'autonomie des r√©dacteurs !
translations.en: **Simple pour les √©diteurs de contenu** qui peuvent modifier visuellement sans alt√©rer le syst√®me de design : bien plus intuitif que l'√©dition d'entit√©s abstraites via des champs gris, comme dans un headless CMS. **Et vous gagnez du temps** gr√¢ce √† l'autonomie des √©diteurs !

segments.source_content: **It's enterprise-ready** with Collaboration, Time-machine, Single Sign-on, GDPR-compliant datacenters, Global CDN for optimized images, E-commerce integration, Scheduled publishing and more.

translations.fr: **Pr√™t pour l'entreprise** avec collaboration, machine √† remonter le temps, authentification unique, datacenters conformes au RGPD, CDN global pour images optimis√©es, int√©gration e-commerce, publication planifi√©e et plus encore.
translations.en: **Pr√™t pour l'entreprise** avec collaboration, machine √† remonter le temps, authentification unique, datacenters conformes au RGPD, CDN global pour images optimis√©es, int√©gration e-commerce, publication planifi√©e et plus encore.

segments.source_content: Get started here: [ReactBricks.com](https://reactbricks.com/?utm_source=this_week_in_react)
## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![SWR 2.0](/emails/issues/128/swr2.png)](https://swr.vercel.app/blog/swr-v2)
**[SWR 2.0](https://swr.vercel.app/blog/swr-v2)**
New major release for the Vercel data-fetching library. Various improvements listed, including:

translations.fr: Nouvelle version majeure de la biblioth√®que de r√©cup√©ration de donn√©es de Vercel. Am√©liorations notables :
translations.en: Nouvelle version majeure de la biblioth√®que de r√©cup√©ration de donn√©es de Vercel. Am√©liorations notables :

segments.source_content:
- New `useSWRMutation` hook
- Simplified Optimistic UI
- Browser extensions: [SWR DevTools](https://swr-devtools.vercel.app/)
- An imperative preloading API
- Improved React 18 support

translations.fr:
- Nouveau hook `useSWRMutation`
- UI Optimiste simplifi√©e
- Extensions navigateur : [SWR DevTools](https://swr-devtools.vercel.app/)
- API imp√©rative de pr√©chargement
- Meilleure prise en charge de React 18
translations.en:
- Nouveau hook `useSWRMutation`
- Optimistic UI simplifi√©e
- Extensions navigateur : [SWR DevTools](https://swr-devtools.vercel.app/)
- API de pr√©chargement imp√©rative
- Meilleure prise en charge de React 18

segments.source_content: [![Vite 4](/emails/issues/128/vite4.png)](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite4.html)
**[Vite 4](https://vitejs.dev/blog/announcing-vite4.html)**

Vite is a frontend tool that keeps growing in popularity. This latest version now uses Rollup 3, which greatly simplifies the management of Vite's internal assets. There are now 2 React plugins with different tradeoffs:

translations.fr: Vite, l'outil frontend gagnant en popularit√©, utilise d√©sormais Rollup 3, simplifiant la gestion des ressources internes. Deux plugins React aux compromis distincts :
translations.en: Vite, outil frontend en pleine croissance, utilise d√©sormais Rollup 3, simplifiant la gestion des ressources internes. Deux plugins React aux compromis distincts :

segments.source_content:
- [vite-plugin-react](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react): esbuild + Babel
- [vite-plugin-react-swc](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react-swc): replace Babel by SWC in dev, which seems to improve cold start and HMR

translations.fr:
- [vite-plugin-react](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react) : esbuild + Babel
- [vite-plugin-react-swc](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react-swc) : remplace Babel par SWC en dev, am√©liorant le d√©marrage √† froid et le HMR
translations.en:
- [vite-plugin-react](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react) : esbuild + Babel
- [vite-plugin-react-swc](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react-swc) : remplace Babel par SWC en d√©veloppement, am√©liorant le d√©marrage √† froid et le HMR

segments.source_content: [![Codux - Visual IDE for React projects](/emails/issues/128/codux.jpg)](https://dev.to/codux/introducing-codux-15j5)
**[Codux - Visual IDE for React projects](https://dev.to/codux/introducing-codux-15j5)**

Nadav is co-founder of Wix and presents us his new project, a visual IDE for React (and soon other frameworks). It's not about replacing your current IDE, but rather about completing it. Codux allows you to work on a component in isolation, including editing props and styles via a visual interface. The video [Meet Codux](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KG6i6cCz0P0) should help you understand better. It's a bit like Storybook, but with the ability to edit, and a bidirectional synchronization with your code.

translations.fr: Nadav, cofondateur de Wix, nous pr√©sente son nouveau projet, un IDE visuel pour React (et bient√¥t d'autres frameworks). Il ne s'agit pas de remplacer votre IDE actuel, mais plut√¥t de le compl√©ter. Codux permet de travailler sur un composant de mani√®re isol√©e, incluant l'√©dition des props et des styles via une interface visuelle. La vid√©o [Meet Codux](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KG6i6cCz0P0) vous aidera √† mieux comprendre. C'est un peu comme Storybook, mais avec la capacit√© d'√©diter et une synchronisation bidirectionnelle avec votre code.
translations.en: Nadav, co-fondateur de Wix, nous pr√©sente son nouveau projet : un IDE visuel pour React (et bient√¥t d'autres frameworks). Il ne s'agit pas de remplacer votre IDE actuel, mais plut√¥t de le compl√©ter. Codux permet de travailler sur un composant de mani√®re isol√©e, y compris la modification des props et styles via une interface visuelle. La vid√©o [Meet Codux](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KG6i6cCz0P0) vous aidera √† mieux comprendre. C'est un peu comme Storybook, mais avec la possibilit√© d'√©diter et une synchronisation bidirectionnelle avec votre code.

segments.source_content:
- üìñ Beta docs: [team page updated](https://twitter.com/reactjs/status/1601328677677338624) + [useTransition demo](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1600709819648069632) + [useSyncExternalStore API ref](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1600530747550564354)
- üìñ [New Supabase Docs, built with Next.js](https://supabase.com/blog/new-supabase-docs-built-with-nextjs): Supabase's doc is migrating from Docusaurus to Next.js, due to the growing need to build something custom. Nevertheless, they give a very positive feedback on Docusaurus.
- üìñ [React Router website repository public](https://twitter.com/remix_run/status/1600979694622367744)
- üìñ [React-Spring - New doc site](https://twitter.com/_josh_ellis_/status/1602253329526128641)
- üìú [Integrate Next.js and Storybook automatically](https://storybook.js.org/blog/integrate-nextjs-and-storybook-automatically/): introduce the automatic support of Next.js via the new [Framework API](https://storybook.js.org/blog/framework-api/) that comes in Storybook 7 (now in [beta](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/releases/tag/v7.0.0-beta.0)). Storybook is able to understand your Next.js project better. No more need to add decorators/addons for navigation, Link and Image components. The support will continue to improve over time: Server Components, next/font...
- üìú [Optimizing Web Fonts in Next.js 13](https://www.lydiahallie.io/blog/optimizing-webfonts-in-nextjs-13): probably the best illustrated article explaining font layout shifts. Explains at the end how Next.js optimizes this for us automatically. Worth reading!
- üìú [Migrating a large, open-source React application to Next.js and Vercel](https://vercel.com/blog/migrating-a-large-open-source-react-application-to-next-js-and-vercel): Vercel is doing a POC of migrating the BBC's open-source site, just for fun üòÑ They're highlighting the benefits gained just by being on a Next.js stack and call BBC to action if they want to pursue this migration.
- üìú [Avoid These Common Pitfalls Of React useState](https://profy.dev/article/react-usestate-pitfalls): 6 common useState anti-patterns presented with solutions + embedded interactive exercice playgrounds
- üìú [The Evolution of urql](https://formidable.com/blog/2022/evolution-of-urql/)
- üìú [Publishing Docusaurus to dev.to with the dev.to API](https://dev.to/johnnyreilly/publishing-docusaurus-to-devto-with-the-devto-api-9bg)
- üìú [An Introduction To RedwoodJS](https://blog.openreplay.com/an-intro-to-redwoodjs/)
- üìú [Using Path Matching in React Router](https://www.taniarascia.com/path-matching-in-react-router/)
- üìú [Testing API Calls in useEffect using React Testing Library and Jest](https://www.taniarascia.com/how-to-test-useeffect-api-call/)
- üí¨ [Improve React Query hydration, Streaming SSR & Server Components](https://github.com/TanStack/query/discussions/4623)
- üê¶ [Xuan Huang - "Forget is in good hands as we now have a team behind it"](https://twitter.com/Huxpro/status/1601345567493214208): Xuan also mentions that he left Meta
- üé® [React-Three-Editor demo - Threejs Journey scene](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1601315795006410752)
- üê¶ ["I fixed vanilla-extract/sprinkles using a vite plugin"](https://twitter.com/astahmer_dev/status/1601246126396428289): new Vite plugin that could significantly reduce the CSS emitted by Vanilla-Extract / Sprinkles
- üê¶ [Ryan Florence - "Next.js isn't really OSS"](https://twitter.com/ryanflorence/status/1600526114010845184)
- üì¶ [React-Nylon](https://github.com/CodyJasonBennett/react-nylon) + [Four](https://github.com/CodyJasonBennett/four): something is cooking. Soon, a lightweight [Three.js / React-Three-Fiber alternative](https://twitter.com/0xca0a/status/1602286391777546242)?
- üì¶ [Remix 1.8](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.8.0): the "React-Router-ing" is progressing
- üì¶ [Chakra UI Figma Kit](https://twitter.com/chakra_ui/status/1602683717830512641)
- üé• [Modern Component Library with React & Storybook](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLKBvDYynKmlWa59k8pnw-EHac2_miPagh)
- üé• [MaterialUI + Qwikify demo](https://twitter.com/Steve8708/status/1601257653367209984)

## üì± React-Native {#react-native}

- üìú [React Native Paper 5.0 ‚Äì What‚Äôs New?](https://www.callstack.com/blog/react-native-paper-5-0): add Material Design 3 "Material You" support, but also keeps the possibility to stay on Material Design 2. There are new components, and helpers to easily integrate the lib with React-Navigation.
- üìú [Microsoft - Announcing the evolution of dep-check: align-deps](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/react-native/2022-11-30-announcing-align-deps/): new version of the dep-check tool from Microsoft that allows to ensure that its monorepo uses the right package versions. Renamed because of a conflict with depcheck. Can now be more easily used on a project other than React-Native.
- üìú [Introducing: Maestro Studio](https://blog.mobile.dev/introducing-maestro-studio-96454c7ca98a): to create end-2-end black box tests via an interface

De nouveaux composants sont disponibles, ainsi que des aides pour int√©grer facilement la biblioth√®que avec React-Navigation.
- üìú [Microsoft - Announcing the evolution of dep-check: align-deps](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/react-native/2022-11-30-announcing-align-deps/) : nouvelle version de l'outil dep-check de Microsoft permettant de s'assurer que son monorepo utilise les bonnes versions de packages. Renomm√© en raison d'un conflit avec depcheck. Peut d√©sormais √™tre plus facilement utilis√© sur un projet autre que React-Native.

De nouveaux composants et des aides facilitent l'int√©gration de la biblioth√®que avec React-Navigation.
- üìú [Microsoft - Annonce de l'√©volution de dep-check : align-deps](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/react-native/2022-11-30-announcing-align-deps/) : nouvelle version de l'outil dep-check de Microsoft permettant de garantir l'utilisation des bonnes versions de packages dans un monorepo. Renomm√© en raison d'un conflit avec depcheck. Peut d√©sormais √™tre utilis√© plus facilement sur un projet autre que React-Native.

## üîÄ Other {#other}

- [Optimize Interaction to Next Paint](https://web.dev/optimize-inp/): Google devs explain how to improve the performance of our apps interactions (the new INP metric). This is particularly interesting for our React SPAs.
- [2022 In Review: What‚Äôs New In Web Performance?](https://www.debugbear.com/blog/2022-in-web-performance):A nice overview of what's new in webperf in 2022. The 2023 predictions indicate work to better measure SPA performance, instead of just the initial page load metrics. TIL about the [soft-navigations](https://github.com/WICG/soft-navigations) repo.
- [Ecma International welcomes new members](https://www.ecma-international.org/news/ecma-international-welcomes-new-members-6/): welcoming Shopify and Vercel
- [Zod 3.20](https://twitter.com/colinhacks/status/1602238724120924160): glad to see the coercion coming, very useful to convert some query-string params (example: ?pageSize=10) into numbers automatically.
- [Vitest 0.27.7](https://github.com/vitest-dev/vitest/releases/tag/v0.25.7): Vite 4 support
- [Tauri Mobile Alpha Release](https://tauri.app/blog/2022/12/09/tauri-mobile-alpha): if I understand correctly it is using a WebView - new competitor to Cordova/Capacitor? ü§î
- [New npm features for secure publishing and safe consumption](https://github.blog/2022-12-06-new-npm-features-for-secure-publishing-and-safe-consumption/): finally a code explorer on the npm site!
- [WebKit Features in Safari 16.2](https://webkit.org/blog/13591/webkit-features-in-safari-16-2/)
- [Bun 0.3.0](https://bun.sh/blog/bun-v0.3.0)
- [Alma - a digital playground for generative graphics](https://twitter.com/emilwidlund/status/1600815398672211969)
- [TypeScript: Should you use Types or Interfaces?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zM9UPcIyyhQ)

- [Optimize Interaction to Next Paint](https://web.dev/optimize-inp/) : Les d√©veloppeurs de Google expliquent comment am√©liorer les performances des interactions de nos applications (la nouvelle m√©trique INP). Particuli√®rement int√©ressant pour nos SPA React.
- [2022 In Review: What‚Äôs New In Web Performance?](https://www.debugbear.com/blog/2022-in-web-performance) : Un bon aper√ßu des nouveaut√©s en webperf pour 2022. Les pr√©dictions 2023 indiquent des travaux pour mieux mesurer les performances des SPA, au-del√† des simples m√©triques de chargement initial. D√©couverte du d√©p√¥t [soft-navigations](https://github.com/WICG/soft-navigations).

- [Optimize Interaction to Next Paint](https://web.dev/optimize-inp/): Les d√©veloppeurs de Google expliquent comment am√©liorer les performances des interactions de nos applications (la nouvelle m√©trique INP). C'est particuli√®rement int√©ressant pour nos applications React SPA.
- [2022 In Review: What‚Äôs New In Web Performance?](https://www.debugbear.com/blog/2022-in-web-performance): Un bon aper√ßu des nouveaut√©s en mati√®re de performance web en 2022. Les pr√©dictions pour 2023 indiquent un travail pour mieux mesurer les performances des SPA, au lieu de se limiter aux m√©triques de chargement initial de page. J'ai d√©couvert le d√©p√¥t [soft-navigations](https://github.com/WICG/soft-navigations).
